intro: Mithridatea cymosa, commonly known as the clustered mithridate, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Mithridatea cymosa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
